title: 111_s2926
content: The "Economic Fairness for Seniors Act" establishes the Medicare Part B premium for 2010 to be the same as in 2009. Additionally, it extends certain economic recovery payments. The American Recovery and Reinvestment Tax Act of 2009 is amended to disburse payments in 2009 and 2010. The Economic Fairness for Seniors Act extends certain economic recovery payments for calendar years 2009 and 2010. The Economic Fairness for Seniors Act extends payments for calendar years 2009 and 2010, with specific provisions for double payments in the same year. The text chunk outlines amendments to payment provisions for calendar years 2009 and 2010, including adjustments to payment amounts and timeframes. In 2010, the special credit for certain government retirees was extended by substituting "2010" for "2009" in relevant sections. The Bureau of Labor Statistics will study if a consumer price index for elderly consumers (CPI-E) better reflects inflation costs for the elderly than the CPI-W. A report will be submitted to Congress within 180 days, potentially leading to the creation of a more accurate CPI-E. Additionally, there will be an offset through a reduction in TARP funds. The Emergency Economic Stabilization Act of 2008 will see a reduction in TARP funds by amending the amount from $1,259,000,000 to $39,259,000,000.
